skill.name: gemini
skill.description: Use when the user asks to run Gemini CLI for code review, plan review, or big context (>200k) processing. Ideal for comprehensive analysis requiring large context windows. Uses Gemini 3 Pro by default for state-of-the-art reasoning and coding.
skill.summary: Enable Gemini CLI integration for comprehensive code review, architectural analysis, and large context processing.
skill.author: softaworks

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing no executable code. Static scanner detected patterns in markdown code blocks (shell command examples) and documentation URLs, all of which are false positives. Safe for marketplace publication.

low_findings.title: Shell Command Patterns in Documentation
low_findings.description: Static scanner detected shell command patterns (e.g., `ps aux`, `pkill`, `timeout`) in markdown code blocks. These are documentation examples, not actual code execution.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: All detected patterns are in markdown code blocks (```bash ... ```) showing example commands for user reference. No actual shell execution code exists in this documentation-only skill.

low_findings.title: Documentation URL References
low_findings.description: Static scanner detected hardcoded URLs (ai.google.dev, github.com) in documentation.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: URLs point to official Google Gemini documentation and are legitimate reference links in documentation.

low_findings.title: Troubleshooting Command Examples
low_findings.description: Static scanner detected file access patterns (lsof, ps) in troubleshooting documentation.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Commands are example troubleshooting steps shown in documentation, not actual executable code.

content.user_title: Run Gemini CLI for code review and analysis
content.value_statement: Large codebases and complex analysis tasks exceed the context limits of many AI models. This skill enables Claude Code to leverage Google Gemini CLI for comprehensive code review, architectural analysis, and processing contexts up to 1 million tokens.
actual_capabilities: Execute Gemini CLI commands for code review across entire codebases
Perform architectural plan and technical specification analysis
Process contexts up to 1 million tokens for comprehensive codebase understanding
Support multiple Gemini models (gemini-3-pro-preview, gemini-3-flash, legacy 2.5 variants)
Provide background execution safety with proper approval mode configuration
Generate structured analysis reports for security, performance, and code quality
limitations: Requires Gemini CLI v0.16.0 or later to be installed separately
Requires Google Cloud credentials configured for API access
Cannot resume interrupted sessions (Gemini CLI is primarily one-shot or interactive)
Does not include built-in multi-modal image analysis capabilities

use_cases.title: Comprehensive Security Code Review
use_cases.description: Run automated security analysis across entire codebases, identifying vulnerabilities, OWASP Top 10 issues, and security anti-patterns using Gemini 3 Pro state-of-the-art reasoning.
use_cases.target_user: Security engineers and developers conducting thorough security audits

use_cases.title: Architectural Plan Analysis
use_cases.description: Analyze technical specifications, system designs, and project roadmaps for scalability concerns, missing components, and integration challenges.
use_cases.target_user: Technical architects and team leads reviewing proposed solutions

use_cases.title: Large Codebase Understanding
use_cases.description: Process and analyze entire codebases with up to 1 million tokens of context to understand architecture, patterns, technical debt, and refactoring opportunities.
use_cases.target_user: Developers onboarding to new projects or legacy system analysts

prompt_templates.title: Basic Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the codebase focusing on security vulnerabilities, performance issues, and code quality. Report findings with severity levels and remediation suggestions.

prompt_templates.title: Security-Focused Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a security audit checking for: OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities, JWT token handling security, session management, rate limiting, password hashing strength, and injection vulnerabilities.

prompt_templates.title: Full Codebase Architecture Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the entire codebase to understand: overall architecture, key patterns and conventions, potential technical debt, dependency cycles, refactoring opportunities, and code organization.

prompt_templates.title: Plan and Specification Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this architectural plan for: scalability concerns, missing components, integration challenges, single points of failure, alternative approaches, and potential bottlenecks.

output_examples.input: Run Gemini code review for security issues
output: 1. HIGH: SQL injection vulnerability in db.ts:42
- Use parameterized queries instead of string concatenation
2. MEDIUM: Hardcoded API key in config.js:8
- Move to environment variables or secrets manager
3. LOW: Missing rate limiting on /api/users endpoint
- N+1 query pattern detected in user.service.ts
- Consider batch loading for related entities
- Data: PostgreSQL with Redis caching layer
- Legacy authentication module (coupled with user service)

best_practices: Always use `--approval-mode yolo` for background or automated tasks to prevent hung processes
Default to `gemini-3-pro-preview` for best analysis quality (35% better at software engineering)
Use timeout wrapper (`timeout 300 gemini ...`) for safety in automated environments
anti_patterns: Never use `--approval-mode default` in background or non-interactive shells (causes indefinite hangs)
Avoid running without specifying model explicitly (may use suboptimal legacy versions)
Do not skip timeout wrappers for long-running analysis tasks

faq.question: Which Gemini model should I use?
faq.answer: Default to `gemini-3-pro-preview` for best quality (76.2% on SWE-bench). Use `gemini-3-flash` for speed-critical tasks requiring sub-second latency. Legacy 2.5 models are available for cost-sensitive scenarios.

faq.question: Why does Gemini hang in background mode?
faq.answer: Using `--approval-mode default` in non-interactive shells causes Gemini to wait indefinitely for user approval prompts. Always use `--approval-mode yolo` or add timeout wrappers for background tasks.

faq.question: How much context can Gemini process?
faq.answer: Gemini 3 models support up to 1 million tokens of input with 64k output. This enables analysis of entire codebases in a single request.

faq.question: Do I need to install Gemini CLI separately?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill requires Gemini CLI v0.16.0 or later to be installed and configured with Google Cloud credentials. Install via: npm install -g @google/gemini-cli

faq.question: Can I resume an interrupted Gemini session?
faq.answer: No. Gemini CLI sessions are primarily one-shot or interactive. Unlike Codex, there is no built-in resume functionality. For follow-up analysis, start a new session with context from previous findings.

faq.question: What approval modes are available?
faq.answer: Three modes: `default` (interactive approval prompts), `auto_edit` (auto-approves edit tools only), and `yolo` (auto-approves all tools). Use `yolo` for background/automated tasks.
